speaker: The Broken Mug
lines: Ale steam and hearth-smoke braid in the rafters like old arguments.
The sign outside still swings from one chain; the other snapped in a storm and stayed snapped.
Dice sit like teeth in a wooden bowl; the bowl knows how to laugh without spilling.
Someone has nailed an antler over the bar; the other antler is a tap handle.
The floor remembers fights the wall does notâ€”scars where chairs changed their minds.
A bard tunes a string that refuses to be a G.
The keeper polishes a glass and finds a map in its reflection.
You step in and every story here takes a breath to make room.

choices.text: Find a seat in the common room.
Lean on the bar and order something that burns.
Read the rumor leafs pinned to the post.
